intro: Phyllodium pulchellum var. glabrius, commonly known as the smooth phyllodium, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its smooth, glabrous stems and foliage make it distinctive among its relatives.
